questions.question_text: What describes a buffer overflow attack?

choices.A: suppressing the buffers in a process
choices.D: fetching data from memory buffer registers
choices.B: injecting new commands into existing buffers
choices.C: overloading a predefined amount of memory

discussion.content:
. Overloading a predefined amount of memory

A buffer overflow attack occurs when an attacker inputs more data into a software application's buffer (temporary storage) than it can handle, causing it to overflow and overwrite adjacent memory locations. This can lead to the execution of malicious code or the manipulation of program behavior, potentially compromising the security and stability of the system. The other options do not accurately describe the nature of a buffer overflow attack.

Selected Answer: C
Buffer Overflow Attack
A Buffer Overflow (or buffer overrun) occurs when the volume of data exceeds the storage capacity of the memory buffer.

https://www.imperva.com/learn/application-security/buffer-overflow/

B
Trusted Certificate Authorities (CAs) play a crucial role in establishing trust for digital certificates in a public-key infrastructure (PKI). However, in the context of the question, the focus is on the exchange of public keys between two specific users (tom0426871442 and dan1968754032). Trusted CAs are typically involved in broader scenarios where a third-party entity vouches for the authenticity of an entity's public key through the issuance of digital certificates.
For individual users exchanging public keys directly, a Web of Trust model is more applicable. In a Web of Trust.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer

Why not B?
This is the definition of Web of trust from Wikipedia:
In cryptography, a web of trust is a concept used in PGP, GnuPG, and other OpenPGP-compatible systems to establish the authenticity of the binding between a public key and its owner. Its decentralized trust model is an alternative to the centralized trust model of a public key infrastructure (PKI), which relies exclusively on a certificate authority (or a hierarchy of such).[1] As with computer networks, there are many independent webs of trust, and any user (through their public key certificate) can be a part of, and a link between, multiple webs.

It seems suitable for the use case in the question

questions.question_text: What should an engineer use to aid the trusted exchange of public keys between user tom0426871442 and dan1968754032?
Which tool gives the ability to see session data in real time?

discussion.content: The best answer is C. "trafshow" is a tool that provides real-time information about network traffic sessions. The tool captures and displays network packets and session data, allowing a network administrator to monitor network activity and troubleshoot problems. "tcpdstat" and "tcptrace" are also network analysis tools, but they do not provide real-time monitoring. "trafdump" is not a valid tool name.

Selected Answer: C
Trafshow is a command-line tool that provides a real-time display of network traffic on a particular network interface. It captures and analyzes the traffic passing through the interface and displays it in a user-friendly format, showing the source and destination IP addresses, protocol type, packet length, and other details.

Trafshow is particularly useful for monitoring network activity in real-time, as it provides an instant view of ongoing network sessions, including active connections, data transfer rates, and error messages. It can help identify issues with network performance, detect potential security threats, and diagnose network problems.
tcptrace does not give the ability to see session data in real-time. Tcptrace is a tool that is used for analyzing packet trace files that have been previously captured. It is not designed for real-time monitoring or capturing of network traffic

Selected Answer: C
The tool that gives the ability to see session data in real-time is trafshow.

trafshow is a network traffic monitoring tool that allows users to view network traffic in real-time. It provides a live display of network traffic by protocol, source and destination IP addresses, port numbers, and other information. This tool can be used to monitor network traffic for troubleshooting purposes or to identify network security threats.

tcpdstat is a tool for collecting and analyzing TCP/IP statistics. It collects data on TCP/IP packet traffic, connection usage, and errors, and can be used for network analysis and troubleshooting.

trafdump is a packet sniffer that captures and logs network traffic for later analysis. It captures packets and saves them to a file for offline analysis.

tcptrace is a tool for analyzing and graphing TCP/IP packet trace files. It can be used to visualize TCP/IP connections and to analyze network performance and behavior.

Selected Answer: D
cptrace is a tool for analyzing TCP/IP packet captures and can display real-time session data. It can provide detailed information about individual TCP sessions, such as packet loss, retransmissions, round-trip times, and other characteristics. This information can be very useful for network troubleshooting and performance analysis.
A tool for real-time network traffic visualization. Description: TrafShow continuously display the information regarding packet traffic on the ...
Tcptrace can't see real time data sessions
Tcptrace ==> is a tool to analyze TCP (and now, also UDP) sessions captured with TcpDump.

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D
D. tcptrace

questions.question_text:

Refer to the exhibit. An engineer needs to identify certificate information on server1234567890. What does the exhibit indicate?

choices.C: The certificate is signed by GTS CA on May 24 and is invalid.
choices.A: Elliptic-curve cryptography is used for the public keys.
choices.D: Asymmetric cryptography is used for key exchange.
choices.B: Key exchange is not secure as the SHA256 hashing algorithm is used.

questions.question_text: Which of these describes volatile evidence?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Caches and Registers
- Data in memory is the most volatile. This includes data in central processor unit (CPU) registers, caches, and system random access memory (RAM). 
- The data in cache and CPU registers is the most volatile, mostly because the storage space is so small.

https://blogs.getcertifiedgetahead.com/cfr-and-order-of-volatility/#:~:text=Caches%20and%20Registers,storage%20space%20is%20so%20small.
